result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's

9:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared by video for Chad S. Conway. Calling 22CF105, 22CF113, 22CF116 & 22TR956. Court review of case. Pfeifer states there has been no discussions yet resolution - was waiting to see how Defendant did in treatment. Court will set out. Bond continued. adj. 09:39 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
all conditions remain ($10,000 total in 22CF113, 22CF105 & 22CF116)

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Chad S. Conway. Calling 22CF116, 22CF113, 22CF105 & 22TR956. Bennett review of case - no additional charges will be filed. Schiek would like to set for pre-trial. Schiek/Bennett statement to bond. Court sets $10,000 cash bond and quashes warrant. adj. 01:25 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
defendant appeared in court - kicked out of program  - dispatch did not yet have warrants.

Defendant to be released from custody at 6:00 a.m. on Thursday, June 30, 2022, to attend inpatient treatment at the Jackie Nitschke Center of Green Bay, Wisconsin. The Defendant shall sign all releases necessary to establish that he has entered the program at the Jackie Nitschke Center/All other
conditions remain.
to amend bond conditions
on stipulation
of the parties

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Chad S. Conway. Calling 22CF113, 22CF105, 22CF116 & 22TR956. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Bennett willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bennett statement to treatment. Bond continued. adj. 10:08 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody. Court reporter appearing by video. Calling 22CF116, 22CF113, 22CF105 & 22TR956. Defendant states trying to obtain attorney Brian Bennett. Court states Defendant eligible for PD. Court will set out. Bond continued. adj. 01:44 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad S. Conway appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF116, 22CF113, 22CF105 & 22TR956. Defendant states contacted PD's office. 22CF116 set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. Defendant states he is an addict - apologizes - would like treatment. Case to transfer to Branch I. adj. 02:42 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
